intro: Stenocoryne charlesworthii, commonly known as the Charlesworth's stenocoryne, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
